sections.title: Drivers
sections.content: See Intel graphics#Installation and Hardware video acceleration

sections.title: Function keys
sections.content:
The most Fn function keys work out of the box. For the Fn function keys F10, F11 and F12 the following must be set as kernel parameter. If tuxedo-drivers-dkmsAUR is installed this is not necessary.

```
acpi_os_name=Linux acpi_osi=
```

sections.title: Keyboard backlight
sections.content: TUXEDO Computers provides a driver for their models with RGB keyboard. TUXEDO Keyboard can be installed manually from source or you use tuxedo-drivers-dkmsAUR

sections.title: TUXEDO Control Center
sections.content: TUXEDO Computers provides their own control center, TUXEDO Control Center (TCC), "to help you control performance, energy, fan and comfort settings". Install the tuxedo-control-center-binAUR package.

sections.title: Suspend
sections.content:
See Power management/Suspend and hibernate#Changing suspend method.

Read more at the help page from TUXEDO [1].

sections.title: Undervolting
sections.content:
With the TUXEDO Premium BIOS you can undervolt the CPU over the BIOS. You can switch between -10mV and -100mV. The selectable values are not dangerous, but test it in small steps. So try -60mV, if it is stable you can try -70mV and so on You also can use intel-undervolt. Read Undervolting CPU for more Informations.

By default -50mV is pre-selected. You can change the value over the BIOS under Setup Utility > Advanced > Advanced Chipset Control > BIOS-controlled Undervolting.

sections.title: BIOS Performance Profiles
sections.content:
With the TUXEDO Premium BIOS you can select one of four Performance Profiles. By default Entertainment is pre-selected.

- Quiet
- Power Saving
- Entertainment
- Performance

You can change the Profile over the BIOS under Setup Utility > Advanced > Advanced Chipset Control > Performance Profile Select.

More informations can found at the help page from TUXEDO [2]

sections.title: Thunderbolt
sections.content: The integrated Thunderbolt Controller will only shown up when a Thunderbolt device is connected or if you manually force Thunderbolt power.
